result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript - Filed by Court Reporter, Barbara Dassow - From Sentencing Held on 04/28/2022.

12:22 PM Defendant Darrick D Smith in court, in custody (OTP'd from MSDF) with Attorney Pablo Galaviz as friend of the Court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS CASE IS DISMISSED AND READ-IN TO 20CF1670.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Darrick D. Smith issued on 02-17-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Comply with all previous set bail conditions in any open cases.

ADDRESS INFO for Darrick D Smith
Current: 1015 N 10th St., c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 816 S 58th St, West Allis, WI 53214

01:21 PM Defendant Darrick D Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Pablo Galaviz who appeared by Zoom.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Galaviz is appointed.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
